content:
Letter from Aged Care dated 9Dec25 # Confirms mum is now Home Care Package Lvl 3, apx $45k (apx $25k or 60% approved for provider services immediately)
The letter details that mum is now at Level 3 for Aged Care Home Care Package. This information has been shared with mum’s health care provider.
Anna from Silverchain is also visiting. # DateTime: Fri, 2nd Jan 2026 11:45.
Darrell’s Google Calendar showing visit event.
Not sure what the reasoning is behind this but I will be present and hope to see Silverchain provide the support mum needs. Mum retels a story of speaking with Silverchain (Helen?) and being told she could not claim any support $ for the cost of the mechanical bed we bought.
This seems contrary to the whole point of having a provider there to help support a person with thier greatest neds. This bed represents sid support at it’s core (i.e., back injury, hip injury, rest & comfort).
Will be good to get Silverchain’s side of the story.
title: Aged care mum level up & Anna from silverchain visit.

content:
So spent most of day with mum and Bryson. Both went down for nap after 12-12:30pm lunch. Was thinking to clean main toilet floor couldn’t find spray bottle of disinfectant. Mum’s bedroom door ajar and saw it on walker tray. Wondered why but thought nothing more and didn’t want to disturb.
Short while later mum cam into lounge where I was on computer with spray bottle still on walker. I asked why. She said she had sprayed her bed with it. I exclaimed that this was not a product you should be spraying on your bed. Read through warnings and clearly stated skin irritant, keep clear of eyes and mouth. Asked mun if she had read the bottle - no, only saw that it killed 99% of germs.
I changed mum’s sheet and sniffed pillows - no descernable odor of bleach. Put bleach dosed sheet in laundry.
I explained to Bryson before I left what had happened and that I was concerned that if mum could do this what next? He will place remaining chemicals etc beyond her reach. Very concerned here that mum is becoming incapable of looking after herslef and may well be putting herself in harms way/ heightened risk.
Called sis and discussed. Call GP soonest as another cognitive test may be best next step. If GP won’t listen to me then maybe POA needs to get involved - see where that gets us (personaly, suspect nowhere). Neither can feed themselves and not entirely sure meds being taken in correct order at correct times.
Mum sounds like she may have been re-infected with scabaies. Suggested call in carpet clearer guy and have entire house done plus upholstery. Remove mattress and burn or otherwise destroy/remove from property.
title: Mum Disinfects Bed

content:
Bryson and I picked out a bed from Maroochydore Lakeside Mobility along with matterss, side protector and rolling pivoting table for mum. Will be delivered in first week of Jan 26. Paid in full today via bank xfer.
Tipped double room mattress over for mum as interim measure until has own bed installed.
Phone message left by Meals on Wheels saying they attempted to deliver food parcels but no-one home. Tried calling back but no answer.
title: Mammas Got a New Bed

content:
Bryson just called to say he is waiting on an ambulance. He is in ‘severe pain’. We didn’t go into details but he wanted to say that the key to the house is under the stereo out the back in the cabinet. He will call as soon as he can with an update.
Mum called shortly after. Is having crushing abdmoinal pains which nurses and staff have said relates to trapped gas. Nurse last night recommended she try and sleep on left side as that is the side the stomach is on and this will help push the gas out. Mum did - and sharted.
Mum cannot be released home if no-one is home. I said I can’t be there as place infested. Mum said Bruce suggested, when he visited her recently, that they shoud bomb the place. Use something available form Bunnings. I suggested that even if mum (and Bryson if it comes to it) stay in respite care for the duration this was a very good idea.
Not sure if this is the product in question Pest Xpert Fogger Bomb
UPDATE: mum just texted to say she has asked Bruce to bomb the house while they are away.
title: Bryson Takes an Ambo Ride

content:
Christmas Wishes FB post and SCUH release. # Mum asked me to send a FaceBook post wishing friends and family a Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year!
She also called me around lunch time to say that she has been told that if the physio okays it she can be released from SCUH tomorrow. Never ones to muck around jettisoning patients ASAP this lot.
title: Facebook Christmas Wishes & SCUH release

content:
Following a YouTube recipe for Anchovy & Garlic Crostini # YouTube Recipe
Tried it with bog standard anchovies and rocked! Can’t wait to try with best-of anchovies =)
title: Anchovy and Garlic Crostini

content:
Bryson called me asking me to make enquiries about getting a mechanical bed for mum. Even suggested we get it before she leaves SCUH this time. I balked a little at this but TBH am thrilled that he is on-board with the idea.
It is one I have floated previously to both BJ and mum and received luke warm to cold response. I had once again promoted the idea gently to both mum and BJ today and have received a more positive response. Maybe the time has come for getting a few things done at Cooroora to provide a higher level of safety and care for mum. No more sleeping half the night in shared bed then awakeing in small hours in pain and finishing rest of night sat in lounge dozing or fully awake. Then sleeping during the day.
Some indicative prices and product examples:
Jannali Bed # Alivio Jannali Bed King Single - Lakeside Mobility indicative price at Country Care Group KCare Alivio Jannali Bed
Comfort Lift # Comfort Lift from Bedside Electric Comfort Lift
Mattress # The subtly named ‘Hospital Ultimate Mattress’ is available through Lakeside Mobility
title: Mechanical Bed for Mum

content: Kendra called - no arrangement made for visit only that Kirsty was AVAILABLE 161225. Need letter from Desh as proof clear of scabies. Can afford weekly visit from physio if no need for other services. Mum recd letter with level 3 approval. Mum hallucinating later in day someone sitting end of bed. Lost bowel control last evening and vomiting all day or sleeping. still no solids intake 171225 morning. Kirsty visit rescheduled for 10am 221225. Earliest equipment purchases not likely until Feb 26. Need OT assessment agreed with Kendra.
title: Silverchain Audit Visit

content:
So mum called to say the keyhole surgery performed at SCUH was a success! She has a tube going up her nse and down her throat (forget why) and a catheter. She is being fed liquids currently including jelly, creamed rice, custard etc but sais she can’t eat them as they are “too sweet”. This from a woman known for her sweet tooth!
She sounds spirited and well though and accepting of the fact that she may not return home unti after Christmas. She is still having abdominal pain and is not yet fit to return hoe so it’s good that SCUH are taking good care of her.
title: SCUH Appendicitis Post Operation Update

content:
Having been vomitting and sleeping in turn all of yesterday an ambulance was called to have her returned to Nambour Hosital. Symtoms included:
vomitting and nausea loss of apetite unable to take solids barely able to take liquids loss of bowel control due to vomiting spasm at one point in evening cramping and sharp pains in abdominal area Later in the day (apx 3pm) mum called me to report it was diagnosed as appendicitis! She is to be transported to SCUH for surgery later today.
title: Mum Sick Returns via Ambulance to Nambour Hospital

content: Spoke with Kendra. Need mum home to tee up home audit even if just on day release from hospital.
title: Phone Call From Kendra Silverchain
